title: Foreign Ministry welcomes Pakistan court verdict on lynched Sri Lankan
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs welcomed this week’s verdict by a Pakistan Anti-Terrorism Court (ATC) of sentencing six accused to death in the killing of Sri Lankan national Priyantha Kumara Diyawadanage in December.

Diyawadanage was tortured and burnt by the mob who accused him of blasphemy early on December 3, 2022 in the Eastern Pakistan city of Sialkot. The killing angered Sri Lankans before ousted Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan apologized for the murder saying it was a “day of shaming for Pakistan” and assured justice.
The Anti-Terrorism Court (ATC) in Gujranwala issued the verdict late on Monday (18).

The incident took place when Diywadanage removed some posters of an extremist group called Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) which had contained Quaranic verses. The group had been unbanned and had over 1,500 members released from prison.
Pakistan businesses in Sialkot raised funds to help Diywadanage’s family in Sri Lanka while many Pakistan civil organizations condemned the attack.
On January 17, 100,000 US dollars and the first salary of 1667 US dollar committed by Rajco Industries where Diywadana worked while brutally murdered were remitted for his family in Sri Lanka
Rajco Industries has pledged the salary for Diyawadana’s family for the next 10 years. (Colombo/April 20/2022)
